cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles ESE of Jacksonville, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then turning north-northeast parallel to the southeast U.S. coastline, heading toward a landfall in northeastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina and then up the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southern North Carolina coast around Surf City/Bald Head Island

weather_observation.watch_coast: Watch Hill RI to Stonington ME including Martha's Vineyard, Nantucket, and Block Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County Line FL northward to South Santee River SC, then north of Surf City NC to west of Watch Hill RI and adjacent bays/sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from Florida to New England
weather_observation.wind: Brief period of tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible this morning as the center passes offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in tidal areas near Savannah around the time of high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1–2 inches of rain; flooding threat is low
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along Georgia beaches
